definition: lit. to meet face to face on a narrow path (idiom)/fig. enemies or rivals meet face to face
narrow/narrow-minded
old variant of 狹|狭[xia2]
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon

sentences.english: Comes face to face with an adversary the brave victory, now judges true brave to be also too early.
sentences.chinese: 狭路相逢勇者胜，现在来判断真正的勇者还为时过早。

sentences.english: In a darkened hangar, the two confronted Dooku.
sentences.chinese: 在一个光线阴暗的机库中，两人与杜库狭路相逢。

definition: to meet/to encounter/to come across
lit. enemies on a narrow road (idiom); fig. an inevitable clash between opposing factions
gorge
to meet/to run into (sb)/to get together (with sb)
confrontation/contest/showdown
clash that leaves both sides shattered
to have a show-down/to fight for mastery/to compete for a championship
to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)
lit. short-weaponed soldiery fight one another (idiom); fierce hand-to-hand infantry combat/to fight at close quarters
sharply opposed to each other, with neither prepared to give an inch (idiom)
two tigers fighting (idiom); fierce contest between evenly matched adversaries
old enemy
see 一決雌雄|一决雌雄[yi1 jue2 ci2 xiong2]
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
destiny will make enemies meet (idiom)/(often said about lovers who have a disagreement)
pinyin: bu4 shi4 yuan1 jia1 bu4 ju4 tou2

definition: to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
